meta.title: Coronavirus Resources - Windsor Public Schools

p.strong: How can I talk with and support my child about Coronavirus?

li.a: Talking to Your Child About Coronavirus
Helping Kids Manage Anxiety around the Corona Virus (Expert Videos)
Mental Health and Coping During COVID-19

div.h3: List of Resources from Town of Windsor Social Services Department
div.p: Click link to view a wide variety of resources available to help with housing, food assistance, energy, employment, mental health services and more. Town of Windsor Resources COVID19

The State of Connecticut has launched the Talk it Out Line 1-833-258-5011, to help parents and caregivers cope with the stress and increased needs resulting from caring for their children during the COVID-19 pandemic. Watch the PSA Here.

img.alt: State of CT Talk It Out Line PSA Notice

li.a: Important Update - Letter to Windsor Families 4.1.20
Important Update - Letter to Windsor Families 3.17.20
Coronavirus Update Letter to Windsor Families 3.16.20

div.p: The Windsor Public Library and Wilson Branch are closed until further notice in response to the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic. Items previously borrowed from the library may be returned in the book drops.
Follow these links to access digital services such as e-books, e-audiobooks and a variety of popular databases.
We thank you for your patience during this difficult time. Stay safe and healthy.

div.h2: Foodshare Drive-Thru at Rentschler Field - Mon 4/20 to Fri 4/24
div.p: Foodshare is launching a new drive-thru food distribution for our Greater Hartford community. Details below, English and Spanish flyers attached. Please help us spread the word.

p.b: Foodshare Drive-Thru at Rentschler Field, East Hartford

ul.li: Monday 4/20 through Friday 4/24 from 8:30 am – 12:00 pm
Rentschler Field, 615 Silver Lane, East Hartford
In order to serve everyone, Foodshare will be providing one distribution of food per car per day

p.b: This will replace our current drive-thru food distributions at the Hartford Regional Market (Foodshare’s satellite facility) so we can accommodate more people.
Other resources for those unable to drive to East Hartford:

div.p: - Foodshare continues to operate Mobile Foodshare on weekdays throughout the region. Text “FOODSHARE” to 85511 or go to www.foodshare.org/mobile to find a site near you.
- To find a food pantry and other resources near you, call 2-1-1 or go to https://www.211ct.org/.

p.strong: Windsor Hunger Action Team Important Updates:

div.p: Mobile Foodshare is still operating.Please encourage people to sign up for the Mobile Texting tool, which will send the schedule to one’s cell phone along with any changes.

ol.li: Text FOODSHARE to 85511, respond with the first 3 letters of the town, and then the month.

If you are a service provider that is currently listed on 2-1-1, please ensure the information is correct and make any changes necessary.
Link to easy instructions on how to make an update (online, email or by phone).
Link to up-to-date information regarding COVID-19 responses from Foodshare.
Link to low cost internet options.

div.p:
Community Network Builder
Foodshare
450 Woodland Ave, Bloomfield, CT 06002
(860) 856-4324
jpalma@foodshare.org

Many communities across the country, and the world, are tasked with navigating a new "normal" as social distancing has lead to school closures and a significant rise in distance learning. The TransACT Community Engagement Team has added resources and articles from other organizations to this newsletter for the benefit of our subscribers during this unprecedented situation.
Guidance from the Department of Education is posted at: ed.gov/coronavirus

h2.span: What You Need To Know About Coronavirus Disease 2019
